page.title: 16PUBLIC HOUSES (PUBS)
page.content: One of the pubs in our survey was a free house. This means that it could sell several different makes and types of beer. You can have stout, lager, cider, bitter or mild. All these are sold in pint or half pint glasses. Some glasses have straight sides and plain glass and others have patterns on and they have handles. Beer can be any colour from pale yellow to very dark brown. Some beers have froth on the top and it is called a head. The place where beer is made is called a brewery. There are small breweries and big breweries. When beer is delivered to the pub it comes in barrels. The big breweries have metal barrels called kegs, and the small breweries have wooden barrels. To get the beer into your glass from the barrels the pub has pumps. Some are worked by hand.
